node.title: Is the holiday over? Airbnb slams 'incredibly damaging' rental policy plans
node.alt: A man sits reading in a neat and tidy loft.
node.description: People who let out holiday homes in WA might have to join a statewide register and limit rental nights under draft rules that booking sites say are the strictest in the nation.
node.content:
["People who let out holiday homes in Western Australia might have to list\u00a0their\u00a0properties\u00a0on a statewide register, and apply for permission to rent them out for more than 60 nights a year, under a draft government planning policy.\u00a0", "Short-stay accommodation booking sites Airbnb and Stayz have criticised the WA\u00a0government's move to regulate the sector, describing the draft proposals as among the strictest in the nation.", "They also warn\u00a0that putting a cap on the number of nights\u00a0homes can be let for will\u00a0have flow-on effects for holiday towns that rely on the business tourists bring in.", "The\u00a0WA\u00a0government has stressed the draft rules are just that \u2014\u00a0and are more lenient than those that already exist in some WA local government areas.\u00a0", "The Australian Hotels Association has welcomed the move to crack down on what it said was an often unregulated sector.\u00a0", "
'Incredibly damaging'
", "The draft policy comes more than two years after a parliamentary inquiry into the regulation of providers such as Airbnb and Stayz.", "The inquiry was prompted in part by the concerns of traditional accommodation businesses, and the frustration of local councils\u00a0about anti-social behaviour at some holiday homes.", "", "
Busselton is a popular spot for holiday homes in WA.(ABC South West: Sharon Kennedy)
", "Airbnb's head of public policy for Australia and New Zealand, Derek Nolan, said the draft rules were among the most restrictive\u00a0in Australia.\u00a0", "He said the\u00a0proposed 60-night cap on short-term letting at \"unhosted\"\u00a0properties\u00a0would be \"incredibly damaging\".", "Stayz Australia's corporate affairs director, Eacham Curry, said he was still looking for more detail in the draft policy.", "\"There's some good and some bad,\" he said.", "\"We've advocated for some time right across the nation for things like a register.\u00a0", "
Rental cap of 60 nights mooted
", "Local governments in WA have varying approaches to regulating holiday houses, with registration schemes already existing in some areas, including Busselton and Margaret River.", "Broome is moving towards a registration scheme.", "Parliamentary Secretary for Planning\u00a0Jessica Stojkovski said\u00a0the suggested night limit\u00a0was more lenient than some existing local rules, but more restrictive in other localities.", "\"We understand that 60 [nights]\u00a0is dramatically lower than what's available right now, which is why we're putting it out for people to make the comments about how much they think is an appropriate time,\" she said.", "Ms Stojkovski indicated the draft policy did not mean a property could not be rented out for more than 60 nights a year \u2014\u00a0just that the owners would need planning permission to do so.\u00a0", "\"If you have a property that you're\u00a0just renting out when you're not using it, and it's underneath the designated cap, then you won't require things like a development application from the local council,\" she said.", "", "
The draft policy has been met with mixed reactions from accommodation providers.(Supplied: Pexels)
", "
Hotels welcome 'good first step'\u00a0
", "Australian Hotels Association chief executive Bradley Woods said the draft policy was a good first step.", "", "
The AHA's\u00a0Bradley Woods says the draft policy is a move in the right direction.(ABC News: James Carmody)
", "\"But those that operate commercial unlicensed accommodation \u2026 will have to register.\"", "Robert McDonald, who owns Bushy Lakes Chalets in Margaret River, was part of the push to see Airbnb and similar providers\u00a0subject to the same rules as traditional guesthouses and chalets.", "Mr McDonald said he supported a statewide registration scheme.\u00a0", "But he said a 60-night cap\u00a0would effectively make holiday house owners exempt from needing approval unless they went over the cap limit \u2014 although they would still need to register."]
